page.title: 11 AN INTERVIEW
page.content: MRS D A NURSE IN THE HOSPITAL DURING WORLD WAR 2 WAS ASKED," WHAT HAPPENED IN{1941}?". NURSES USED TO PACK THEIR SUITCASES WITH WHATEVER THEY NEEDED AND WHEN THE ALARM WENT OFF THEY WOULD TAKE THE PATIENTS DOWN TO THE CELLARS.THEY HAD TO SLEEP ON VERY UNCOMFORTABLE STRAW MATTRESSES. THE{GERMAN PLANES}WOULD COME OVER BETWEEN 10 AND 12 O'CLOCK AT NIGHT. A BOMB DID LAND IN THE FIELD NEXT TO THE HOSPTAL BUT DID NO DAMAGE. NURSES USED TO RIDE AROUND THE VILLAGE ON BIKES WITH VERY LOW LIGHTS WHEN THEY WERE ON NIGHT DUTY. EVERY WINDOW IN THE HOSPITAL HAD BLACK CURTAINS SO THAT THE PILOTS WOULD NOT SEE THE HOSPITAL. WE HAD TROUBLE WITH THE TRAMPS BECAUSE THEY USED TO SLEEP IN THE CELLARS AND IT WAS THE JOB OF THE NURSES TO SEND THEM ON THIER WAY.
